bibl.title: Alfonso Gagliardi v. T.W. Lynch. Order to Show Cause
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Application of Alfonso Gagliardi, for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
This matter coming on to be heard upon the application of the petitioner herein for a Writ of Habeas Corpus; and the Court having read the petition and being now fully advised in the premises;

IT IS ORDERED AND DIRECTED THAT T.W. Lynch, Acting Commissioner of Immigration, at the City of Seattle, Arthur J. Kahl, Immigration Inspector of the United States, at the City of Seattle, and E.J. Henning, Assistant Secretary of Labor, be and they and each of them hereby are directed to appear in the Court Room of the undersigned Judge at Seattle, King County, Washington in the Post Office Building, at the hour of 2 o ck on the 19 day of J 1921, and then there show cause, if any there be, why the Writ of Habeas Corpus prayed for in the petition filed herein, should not issue in accordance with the prayer of said petition;

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED AND DIRECTED that the above named T. W. Lynch, Acting Commissioner of Immigration, Arthur J. Kahl, Immigration Inspector of the United States, and E. J. Henning, Assistant Secretary of Labor, be and they are each of them hereby enjoined and restrained from removing the said petitioner from the City of Seattle and from out the jurisdiction of this
In obedience to the written order in on the 13th day of Dec. 19th 1921 served the within order on the Hon Luther Weedin Com. of Immigration Seatte Wa
Filed in the United States District Court
Court pending the further order of the Court.
DONE IN OPEN COURT this 13 day of December, 1921.
In the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Alfonso Gagliardi for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the United States District Court
